WorkItem.ClosedComment: User was able to get this fixed.
WorkItem.Description: The filter by source section should also be extended to include Firelands raid nh/h and the new Baradin Hold boss.
WorkItem.Summary: Filter by source section: Extend with T12 content / new Baradin Hold boss

Comments.Message: Occu'thar is already part of the Filtering system. I have him under the Baradin Hold filter. Baradin Hold has his own filter (similar to how Wintergrasp had it's own filter back during Wrath.

No it isn't. It shows only Argaloth and "Other".
Remember I'm talking about the Filter by Source.
Are you sure you have the latest Rawr? Because these filters have been in for over a month and a half now. If you don't see them, go to the options menu and select "Reset All Caches."

I'm not using the offline version.
Cache reset didn't help (it doesn't seem to be data related anyway).
Strange things... 
It shows Rawr 4.2.1.0 - the online version should be up to date anyway.
I just checked the online version using my toon (Turambar@Akama TG Fury Warr) and had no problems seeing or deselecting/selecting Occuthar under the Baradin Hold Source filter.

The only other thing I could suggest is to manually delete the silverlight saved file. If your using Windows Vista or Windows 7 go to

C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Microsoft\Silverlight\is

Then delete all of the sub-folders in this folder. The next time you go to Elitist Jerk's Rawr site, it will force a new download. If it is still not working please notify us.

After having deleted the subfolders it works now.
Issue can be closed.

Thanks!
